qas.question: What percentage of the population over 15 could read and write Spanish?
What percentage of children ages 8-14 could read and write Spanish?
What percentage of children age 6-14 attend an institution of education?
What percentage of the population have obtained a college degree?

context: According to the Instituto Nacional de Estadística, Geografía e Informática (INEGI), <a0_0>95.6%<a0_0/> of the population over the age of 15 could read and write Spanish, and <a1_0>97.3%<a1_0/> of children of ages 8–14 could read and write Spanish. An estimated <a2_0>93.5%<a2_0/> of the population ages 6–14 attend an institution of education. Estimated <a3_0>12.8%<a3_0/> of residents of the state have obtained a college degree. Average schooling is 8.5 years, which means that in general the average citizen over 15 years of age has gone as far as a second year in secondary education.
